ghostPost.title: How to resolve errors when running ghost start
ghostPost.excerpt: What to do when running into errors using the ghost start command.
ghostPost.meta_title: How to resolve errors when running `ghost start` - FAQ
ghostPost.meta_description: What to do when running into errors using the ghost start command.

primary_tag.name: Errors
primary_tag.description: Troubleshoot common errors and issues for the open source Ghost publishing platform!
primary_tag.meta_description: Troubleshoot common errors and issues for the open source Ghost publishing platform!

tags.name: Errors
tags.description: Troubleshoot common errors and issues for the open source Ghost publishing platform!
tags.meta_description: Troubleshoot common errors and issues for the open source Ghost publishing platform!

ghostPost.plaintext:
If an error occurs when trying to run ghost start  or ghost restart, try using 
ghost run  first to check that Ghost can start successfully. The start  and 
restart  commands are talking to your process manager (e.g. systemd) which can
hide underlying errors from Ghost.

Find your Ghost log files in /content/logs/  to identify if the problem exists
with Ghost itself, or the process manager.
ghostPost.html:
If an error occurs when trying to run ghost start or ghost restart, try using ghost run first to check that Ghost can start successfully. The start and restart commands are talking to your process manager (e.g. systemd) which can hide underlying errors from Ghost.

Find your Ghost log files in /content/logs/ to identify if the problem exists with Ghost itself, or the process manager.
